html:
9.21.17  10:15 am   what do i do when ive lost passion for something ive been doing for a long time and ive set my future around

     discover a new planet! and kick out the previous inhabitants

9.21.17  10:13 am   opinion on backpacks?

     you can also wear them on the front

9.21.17  10:13 am   i dont know if ill ever be able to express how much you mean to me. at the very least i hope you know on your worst days that there are people in the world who will always support you, unless you do something really bad, like step on a puppy. that wouldnt be a very good thing to do. maybe you shouldnt step on a puppy. 

     i will try not to

9.21.17  9:32 am   Will you throw a party if you get your first youtube check?

     i've gotten checks from youtube before

9.21.17  9:07 am   Bill, I have been feeling down ever since about a week ago, and I have no idea why or how. Do you have any advice for me?

     have you tried having an unprecedented breakthrough in quantum computing

9.21.17  8:20 am   Can you do a backflip?

     it depends how much you pay me

9.21.17  7:56 am   Can you make a long video on something different than history but similar to the history of the world, i guess?

     sure. although not quite as long. prefer to keep it under 7 minutes. under 5 would be even better

9.21.17  6:03 am   I want to sing better. Can you give me some techniques or tips?

     the main tip is to sing more. and do it in the way that is most enjoyable

9.21.17  2:09 am   How do I stop thinking about the stupid and embarrassing things I've done in the past? Sometimes I bang my head and want to kill myself because how stupid and useless I was.

     the only way to escape this is to do some more, new stupid things to think about

9.21.17  2:04 am   Whats your next few videos going to be about? Will they be songs, shorts or longer videos?

     a mix of songs and other types of medium size videos

9.21.17  2:01 am   i keep recording audio journals so i don't have to write everything down but i hate the sound of my voice so that makes me want to not listen to the things i said but the things i say are important and now i can't remember what i said but id rather have krazy glue funneled into my ear than listen to the recordings so how can i hate my voice less

     you might have to stick to text for a bit longer, until you get more confident and comfortable

9.21.17  1:51 am   sometimes you don't have to pay people for them to make professional work. it depends on the person actually but there are other people out there who just want to express themselves by doing what they do best, i believe.

     right, but their commitment will be dependent on delicate factors, such as how your personal relationship with them might be going

      if you can afford to pay them, they might keep working with you unwillingly for money and that's a problem.

     sure, and they also 'unwillingly' need to eat to survive

      if you can't, authority and control will always be a problem and relationships will affect the work. yes, there are other people like us but what if we're not lucky enough to find anyone?

     ah, too real

     i can't even find a fucking solution to these problems. i'm not talking about collab, i hope you understand, it's more about a crew. i'm not bad with people but i want the thing i make to be mine and i just can't follow orders.

     i know what you mean

     i need to be alone to be able to write anything, so poems, lyrics, stories and such are not a problem but scripts ... plays i have to direct and movies/shows i plan to make in the future feels like attaching rocks to my feet an d letting my originality sink because, you know, people. now if i don't like something i can just change it or get on the stage and perform myself but what will happen when things get more and more serious?

     you will have to work your way up. i am just barely even beginning to think about scratching the surface of various types of 'crew' solutions. but in my model, people need to be paid if you really want to expect them to do work and spend time, consistently, whether it's monday or friday

     i want to be free but there has to be a way to do it without being alone.

     most people would say yes. for me, weirdly, for reasons i have never understood, again and again the answer is unfortunately no. i have gotten used to this by now

      i'm ok with being alone, i want to be, but this is never going to work for performing and shooting. since my primary goal was always writing, anything and everything, i'm used to be on my own but if i can't work this play and the crew thing out, i have to sacrifice the scripts and some of my dreams. i don't understand why this is happening.

     it's called earth and it's rough. you gotta bury things in the dirt and stomp on it until it makes food. and you gotta keep doing it. you may even have to hire animals if u can't do it fast enough. i don't know why we're here, it's pretty, but it's rough. it has actually gotten much much easier throughout the milleinia and centuries, but i'm telling you it's rough, and i think the name of this planet actually means 'challenge.' but it's important to remember that that's what you came here for, possibly because you were bored before, or maybe for a different reason, i'm not sure

     the first play took long and it consumed me but everything was good, i never thought i will do it again. i don't think it's about compromising, i was expecting that. i know i am the director and everything is under my control, just like i wanted. i really don't understand why.

9.21.17  1:44 am   why did you make the history of the history of the entire world, i guess video

     explaining the entire history of japan (or at least sort of pretending to) in a 9 minute video was a big breakthrough for me. it was the obvious next step to raise the stakes to the entire world. what could go wrong

9.21.17  1:25 am   How do you keep yourself happy

     succeed wildly

9.21.17  1:23 am   Describe yourself in a nutshell

     i am not in a nutshell

9.21.17  1:19 am   How do you make tunes???

     i have no idea

9.21.17  1:18 am   Is that sawtooth-like lead sound you use in your jazzy ltr songs a sound you made yourself? 

     there are many different variations and i made them myself

9.21.17  12:31 am   Are you going to take ventriloquism now that Darci Lynne won America's Got Talent?

     i studied ventriloquism as a small child

9.21.17  12:26 am   how can i find people like myself

     i have no idea, but if you be yourself louder then people might find you more easily. that's just my best guess, i'm not sure if it's the right answer

9.21.17  12:14 am   9.19.17  7:43 pm    Re: Randomization. Since I'm sure you've already thought of this, I wanted to ask why this isn't a solution: Why not categorize your sounds, and when you need, for example, a bass sound that hasn't come up yet, you just pick a random bass sound?

     one of the most magical things about the randomization system is that it forces you to realize all the ways that instruments can be used for a different category than you expected

9.20.17  11:44 pm   Did gaining a bigger audience make you more picky about your new content? 

     no, but gaining better skills raised my expectations

9.20.17  11:40 pm   i want to make music so bad but i just don't fucking know how and it feels like i'm being buried alive by all the possibilities and i was late to the game in terms of experimenting and i feel like i will never acquire the skills i need at this rate

     no one knows how. there is no way to write music. other than the way each person makes up on their own. you might even have an interesting advantage because you don't think you know anything. but either way, you have to try something first. it's like untying a knot which is trapped in a block of ice. you are not going to even touch the knot until you break the damn ice. to break the ice, just hit it with something large, anywhere on the exterior. anywhere, it doesn't matter. or if you prefer to just raise the tempurature of the room that might do it

9.20.17  10:34 pm   Ya know how music is all like, "Hey bud, you can write me, but you better write me bad a lot until you write me good," and then you're like, "no, i wanna write you good right now," and music say, "nah, bud, it's gotta be bad. Later it can be good, but be bad right now," and you say, " fine, whatever," and then you make music and it is always bad and then you are like, "when will it get good," and then music is all like, "it doesn't. It is always bad, and that's really good," and then you're like, "that makes no fucking sense what are you talking about," and music says, "well, I was just thinking that maybe I could, like, inspire you by saying that music is bad and you've been making bad music so I'm just trying to show that, like, if you make the music bad it is good or something," and then there's a long pause and then you're like, "I'm gonna make good music now," and music says, "fine whatever." Does that happen to you?

     i was going to say no, but that's actually pretty accurate

9.20.17  10:24 pm   Do you appreciate the existence of trousers?

     yes

9.20.17  10:13 pm   have you always considered pluto to be a planet?

     i can't even see it. i will have to trust those who can to make those decisions

9.20.17  9:49 pm   Bill, I want answers

     well you came to the right place

9.20.17  9:43 pm   what goes on inside of the mind of the almighty bill wurtz

     i am only partially mighty, but i try to stay focused and keep things simple, and always continue to make progress

9.20.17  9:37 pm   How long did "the entire history of the world, i guess" take

     11 months

     and how much effort?

     i think i blacked out

9.20.17  9:30 pm   some time ago i realized how Uncomfortable fixed labels were, and i decided i disliked labels entirely and should avoid them completely. it didn't really work, i found myself being attracted to labels sometimes, but then, in the same situations, sometimes getting really uncomfortable with them. which was confusing, but now i think I've figured it out: i like labels, but only when i can play with and mess around with them however i want. is this something you can relate to?

     oh hell yeah

9.20.17  9:26 pm   is it ever not fun to be bill wurtz

     it is somewhat challenging, but ultimately very rewarding

9.20.17  9:10 pm   do you like reading?

     yes. in fact i would not be able to operate this questions page without reading

9.20.17  9:10 pm   hey bill, on a scale of 0% to 100%, where is the progress of the video you are working on?

     i can't tell you

9.20.17  8:29 pm   I'm blown away when I see a band playing a really long song with lots of changes and intricate melodies/harmonies and rhythm hits and stuff, but they're playing it without looking at any sheet music. Or Ill see somebody playing the entire "rite of spring" or something on piano without any music in front of them. Do you think being able to memorize long and intracite, detailed pieces of music is a skill that you can improve upon over time? Like can you sharpen your "musical memory" or whatever you want to call it? Does it just start to automatically  become easier to do the longer you've been playing? 

     it's really no harder than memorizing a paragraph full of words, in your native language

9.20.17  8:20 pm   Can a whale play music?

     sure

      Can people in Whales play music?

     sure

     Can music play whales?

     maybe

     Can people in whales play whales?

     sure

      Can people in music play Whales?

     yes

     Can play whales music?

     what

      Can music whales Whales?

     you don't need to whale a whale. they already are

     
These are questions that keep me up

     i don't believe you

     and make me wonder if reality really isn't a hologram. Help please.

     what the heck is a hologram

9.20.17  7:38 pm   What do you think of your first video? (Well it's not so hard to do) 

     well, it was not so hard to do. and neither was the song, which was recorded 6 months earlier

9.20.17  7:28 pm   have you ever judged a cover by its book

     yes

9.20.17  7:22 pm   Why is the weather clear?

     to keep it interesting

9.20.17  7:12 pm   Do you think that eucalyptus is a cool word?

     sort of

9.20.17  6:56 pm   Brains

     ah, you make a good point

9.20.17  5:53 pm   I actually appreciated the long answer! It's nice to hear about your creative process and how you try to improve it. But it does seem like you do a lot of work; how do you avoid crashing?

     always looks for ways to make things simpler, and easier, and return to the original essence and inspiration of what i meant to be doing here

9.20.17  5:50 pm   how long did it take to study for the world video? i know it's been a while since it came out, i'm just now finding your website and i'm still blown away by the video.

      many weeks/months.

9.20.17  5:27 pm   What to do when you need to do something but you can't make yourself get out of bed?

     try again

9.20.17  5:17 pm   My classmates keep on telling me that you are dead and you use Windows XP, How would you handle this?

     i guess i will explain that neither are true. and then you will have to decide whether to believe me

9.20.17  4:16 pm   what do you think a speck of lint would see from its perspective on your shirt? 

     it depends which direction it is looking

9.20.17  4:12 pm   hey Bill, i just read your update on the new project and how you are looking for faster ways to make videos. This is a very relevant issue for me as well, and i have some ideas that might be of use... i started out making everything in After Effects (i dont know what software you use but this should be relevant regardless) which is great and amazing but non efficient especially when you have a identity of textures and tones that is some kind of starting point and a through line through all your different projects but reusing previous stuff from other After Effects projects feels werid and is not ideal. i have recently been learning a coding language called Processing which i am using to create programs to execute visuals before i bring them into After Effects. For a a hopefully relevant example to you, i could make a program where i can type in text, have a rgb slider for base color of text, create duplicates of text on top of one another with differ ent colo rs and choose a display style like a repeating pattern of text or a silly wobble distortion or something. Then i can save the text as a picture or video and then do the polishing in After Effects. These little programs you can make for various reasons and reused without loosing freshness or constraints as you can easily add a few parameters to the code for every projects adding on to the base you have built up which you can execute and use immediately. The beginning of this process is the worst by far and takes time but it seems to me like the efficiency ratio is a constant upward line with no plateauing and from your knowledge of html from making this website, i think the starting momentum would not be too terribly slow. this might be helpful to you, thank you for changing the world all the time

     i would like to talk more about this! have you checked out my email address on the email page of this site

9.20.17  3:17 pm   am i ever going to feel happy again

     yes

9.20.17  3:08 pm   I want do a "copy" of your video "history of the entire world, i guess" for a school kind of show talent, i would obviously give you full credit but i wanna do it all by 0 and making all the presets and melodies, how much time do you think am i going to spend if i don't even know with what to start editing?

     well, after many years of experience, it took me 11 months, working as fast as possible. but maybe you can do it quicker, i don't know for sure

9.20.17  2:48 pm   Do another history video

     how about something a little different

     survival, and competition for resources

9.20.17  1:34 pm   Is doing nothing a good strategy for finding something to do?

     sometimes
